How do I import multiple WIFs in one batch for public (transparent) addresses, and how do I import a single WIF for a private address, in Verus?

To import multiple WIFs in one batch for public (transparent) addresses in Verus, you need to follow a specific procedure. First, go to the `settings` section of your Verus wallet and select the chain you want to use in the top-right corner. Then, for every WIF except the final one, enter the following command:
```
run importprivkey "<wif>" "" false
```
Replace `<wif>` with the actual WIF you obtained from the `convertpassphrase` command earlier.

For the final WIF, use the following command:
```
run importprivkey "<wif>" "" true
```
This last command triggers the chain to rescan all addresses in your wallet, including all the addresses you just imported.

Note that the GUI wallet may not show any progress on the import and may give messages that the RPC daemon is not reacting. This process may take some time to finish in the background, especially if the address has many transactions on it.

On the other hand, to import a single WIF for a private address, you can use the following command:
```
run z_importkey "<wif>" "yes" 1
```
Again, replace `<wif>` with the actual WIF you obtained from the `convertpassphrase` command earlier.

Remember to be patient, as the import process may take some time to complete, especially if the address has many transactions.

## Importing multiple WIFs in one batch for public (transparent) addresses
To import your address, go to `settings` --> `Coin Settings`, select the chain you want to use in the top-right corner and enter the following command for every WIF except for the final one:
```
run importprivkey "<wif>" "" false
```
Import the final WIF with this command:
```
run importprivkey "<wif>" "" true
```
The last command triggers the chain to rescan all addresses in your wallet, including all the addresses you just imported.
Replace `<wif>` with the actual **wif** (like the one you got from the `convertpassphrase` command earlier).Note: Don't use the WIF from the example above, but use the one from the CLI-interface in Verus Desktop.The GUI wallet will not show any progress on the import and may give messages that the RPC daemon is not reacting. It will take quite some time for the process to finish in the background, especially if the address has many transaction on it.## Importing a single WIF for a private address
To import your address, go to `settings` --> `Coin Settings`, select the chain you want to use in the top-right corner and enter the following command:
```
run z_importkey "<wif>" "yes" 1
```
Replace `<wif>` with the actual **wif** you got from the `convertpassphrase` command earlier.Note: Don't use the WIF from the example above, but use the one from the CLI-interface in Verus Desktop.The GUI wallet will not show any progress on the import and may give messages that the RPC daemon is not reacting. It will take quite some time for the process to finish in the background, especially if the address has many transaction on it.
